instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no data on screen, {SOLUTION: BLOWN L9004}
threads.message:
got in an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers on to a chime, has no backlight or data.

Where should i start testing?

Sorry for my inexperience.
Thanks
Nate

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no data on screen, {SOLUTION: BLOWN L9004}
threads.message: Check LVDS connector and power to L9004 and L9008.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no data on screen, {SOLUTION: BLOWN L9004}
threads.message: awesome thanks.  the L9004 was dead. bklt was out also from a missing capacitor around the smc and soda pop under the smc. uc'd it and everything is working good. also changed the ldvs connector because of soda but might have been okay.
